decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: Site Location Plan, Existing Plans SR/0224/FP1, Existing Elevations SR/0224/FP2, Proposed Plans SR/0224/FP3, Proposed Elevations SR/0224/FP4, Proposed Site Plan SR/0224/FP5/REV, Block Plan SR/0224/FP6, Section AA Block Plan SR/0224/FP7, Design and Access Statement.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the provided details and carried out in accordance with the approved plans as listed in condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and Polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | A minimum of four (4) cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development in a secure compound. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom adjoining the communal main entrance and below kitchen/dining/living room of separate dwelling. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Conversion of single dwellinghouse into two self-contained flats and associated external alterations;  provision of associated car parking space, cycle storage and refuse storage facilities
